case_title: DALSUKH RAI JAIDAYAL, In re vs N/A
reference_no_or_id: I. T. A. No. 2623 of 19Case No. 15 of 1952

accussed_details.name: Dalsukh Rai Jaidayal
allegation: Claim for tax exemption under Section 25(4) of the Income-tax Act

complaint_summary: The appellant claimed exemption from tax under Section 25(4) of the Income-tax Act for income earned during the accounting period October 19, 1942, to October 7, 1943, due to succession of business by a partnership firm on October 8, 1943.
investigation_summary: The Income-tax Appellate Tribunal determined that the date of succession was October 8, 1943, and the previous year for tax purposes ended on October 7, 1943. No income was earned between October 7, 1943, and October 8, 1943.
judgment_summary: The court held that the appellant was not entitled to exemption under Section 25(4) of the Income-tax Act for the period October 19, 1942, to October 7, 1943, as no income was earned between the end of the previous year and the date of succession. The question referred was answered in the negative.
Decision_or_verdict: Question answered in the negative; appellant not entitled to tax exemption.
legal_arguments: Interpretation of Section 25(4) of the Income-tax Act regarding the 'end of the previous year' and 'date of succession'.
Reference to Supreme Court judgment in Commissioner of Income-tax v. Srinivasan.
Reference to Bombay High Court judgment in Ambaram Kalidas v. Commissioner of Income-tax.
key_issues: Interpretation of 'end of the previous year' under Section 25(4).
Eligibility for tax exemption due to business succession.

legal_terms.Previous Year: Accounting year preceding the date of succession.
legal_terms.Succession: Transfer of business ownership from one entity to another.

words_and_phrases.Exemption: Relief from tax liability under specific provisions.
words_and_phrases.Date of Succession: The date on which business ownership changes.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved interpretation of Section 25(4) of the Income-tax Act regarding tax exemption for income earned during the accounting period preceding business succession. The court ruled against the appellant, stating no income was earned between the end of the previous year and the date of succession.

legal_principles.section_25_4: Exemption from tax for the period between the end of the previous year and the date of succession.
legal_principles.bombay_high_court_precedent: Ambaram Kalidas v. Commissioner of Income-tax

key_findings.income_exempt_period: None, as no income was earned between October 7, 1943, and October 8, 1943.

reasoning.interpretation: The previous year for section 25(4) is the completed accounting year immediately preceding the date of succession.
reasoning.application: No income was earned between the end of the previous year and the date of succession, thus no exemption applies.

costs.final_costs: Parties to bear their own costs
